The room opposite me had constant knocking on the door , doors slamming , opened my door to see afro caribbean youths trying to get in room opposite me, i asked them to keep the noise down as i could not sleep. they just stared at me. half hour later could not take the noise any more, opened my door to find more males outside and more along the long corridor, drinking beer and the smell of cannibis was rife, went to reception to report on events, i requested another room, returned to my room to collect my valuebles, on my floor many males coming out of different rooms all going towards the room opposite mine, 4-5 fire extinguisers thrown on the corridor floor, beer cans left around. i vacated my room and had to pass all these people in the corridor, who by now sensed i was leaving, the started to argue and fight amongst themselves. i went back down to reception to get them to call the police. who initially would not come, but came eventually, and once again a 2nd time to throw them out. the guy on reception was on his own and was threatend by 3 of the youths. their was no other staff to help him, one guy and no security it is a joke..... it transpires all rooms had been booked with fake Identities and stolen cards.all youths questioned had false names etc?. My nights sleep was ruined, other guests on the floor were to frighttend to open their doors. the next days sightseeing of london was an non event ,due to lack of sleep. I must commend the guy on reception , on his own in a very bad situation. I WROTE TO THE MANAGING DIRECTOR OF TRAVELODGE 2 DAYS LATER , 4 WEEKS ON AND I STILL HAVE NOT HAD A REPLY, OR APOLOGY, OR COMPENSATION. this may have been a one off, so don't let me put you off staying here , but this it how it was. i have rated it based on my one dreadful night travelodge must employ security to sort out unruly guests or someone will get hurt posted from warwickshire sept 29th 2010

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - £64 B & B for two people for two nights in London”
Reviews.Author: MISCAL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels but never a Travelodge but thought we would give it a try because of their £19 room rate. Having never previously used an express check in we found it to be a very easy and quick experience with a member of staff on hand if there were a problem. Our room and facilities were comfortable and spotless. Being a city hotel, we didn't expect a view. The breakfast was very nicely presented with plenty of everything on the menu available. The staff in all area were very smart,polite and helpful. Would definitely stay again especially with a bus stop right outside the door straight to the square mile and Thames at London Bridge. Sorry about the three stars for sleep quality but that was because of the noise from the extractor fan. Miscal

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, convinent”
Reviews.Author: Jop23
Reviews.Content: This place is fine, it's central, clean, modern and safe. Yes it's not cheap, but if you want cheap don't go to London!

Reviews.Title: “great for a cheap break”
Reviews.Author: playgal8
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not as bad as some reviews say..its absolutely fine i did find it more difficult to find than some other travelodges ive stayed in but if u get a cheap deal go for it! i had the room for £19 and would certainly book it again its really clean with flat screen tv , comfy bed its a great place to stay if you just want to sleep in the room like i did.. i cant comment on the food as i didnt eat it but there were about 4 towels for the two of us for one night..plenty of tea and coffee close to the buses and the tube stations..and no i didnt get any bites from bugs or anything my room was immaculate.. if your not too fussy go ahead and book it.. my experience was fine

Reviews.Title: “Run down with useless staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller2501
Reviews.Content: Truly disappointing stay. As others have said, usually happy with Travelodges great deals and pleasant rooms for a simple nights stay. On this occasion we waited 45minutes upon arrival for the room to be cleaned, went to our room to find a clump of hair on the bed (as if pulled from a hairbrush), only one towel, and the shower to be not working. Eventually managed to change rooms, and the nights sleep here was ok (nothing memorable) - concrete block outside the window and greasy smells from the kitchen coming in through the room vent. During our evening meal at the hotel restaurant, the bar staff seemed unable to assist us in simple requests such as our enquiry as to the price of a glass of wine, and appeared to be hassled that we were even in the restaurant. Throughout the stay were shocked at both the quality of the experience and the attitude, lack of manners and capability of the staff at City Road Travelodge and as a result would be extremely reluctant to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews make out & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shaunus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge City Road on Bank Holiday Monday and was a little apprehensive after reading the reports and staying as a lone female with 2 teenage girls. Well I was pleasantly suprised - 3 mins walk from Old Street Tube Station which nis 2 stops away from Euston and check in was easy - love the express checkouts what a brilliant idea no need to queue everything done in a few clicks. Ok the hotel room was very basic but it had tea and coffee making facilities, tv etc but you know what to expect from a Travelodge - it is convenient, cheap and cheerful. The rooms were a little stuffy but with the window open for a while it soon cooled down. I think people just like to find things to moan about to be honest. The hotel was very secure and you could only get to the rooms via a card key. Breakfast - again after reading the reviews apprehensive but went down at 8am and lots of tables, good selection of cereals, fruit, drinks and cooked breakfast- well worth the £6.50 pre paid for 3 of us! yes 1 adult and 2 children cost me £6.50 - amazing and very very good value and as said earlier plenty of choice and not over crowded. All in all a good location, good service , good staff and overall good stay. Would definitely stay here again when visiting London. £31.50 for bed and breakfast for 1 adult and 2 children near the centre of London - what a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “£115.00 for a 6x6 noisy incubator. Slow death by heat and white noise.”
Reviews.Author: JKBN
Reviews.Content: Would never stay here again. Have paid a lot less at better quality and equipped hotels. We were on the 7th floor at the back of the hotel. It was like an oven in the room, no a/c. When we opened the window for ventilation, the noise from the a/c units on neighbouring buildings was deafening. Also the breeze caused the cheap blinds to constantly bang on the the window frame. It was like chinese water torture. This hotel is fine if you want to pay £19.00, planning on spending £19.01, then look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: molly75
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here, but we were pleasantly surprised. The reception was welcoming and we used the express check in machines, whcih were easy to use and avoided us standing in a queue at reception. There is a large restaurant there which looked nice, but we never used it. The room was small, but clean and modern looking. We only had a view of a wall out of our window, but we didn't go to London to sit in a hotel looking at a view! But as mentioned in a previous review, our hotel room was boiling hot! We tried sleeping with the window open but being London it was quite noisy. Its very quiet with the window closed, but also very hot. We had a flat screen tv with freeview channels in our room, as well as tea and coffee with kettle. The bed was not the comfiest, very soft mattress and was quite small. The bathroom was modern, but quite compact. But the location was great, just 2 underground stops from Kings Cross/St Pancras. It was a two minute walk from Old Street Station to the hotel. There are also a few shops and restaurants nearby. A Tesco Express just outside the hotel and Subway and an Indian Restaurant on the opposite side of the road. Overall, this hotel was great value for money as we only paid £29 for one night. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “too hot - subtropical temperatures and a sock....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PinkRosa
Reviews.Content: I paid £360 for 3 nights, last night was my first night and I couldn't sleep at all. The room is on the 6th floor (I requested a quite room, the lady in reception was nice) and they have this huge extractors on the top that go on all night, so it is noisy. On top of that it was boiling hot in the room and on top of that the windows have restrictors so they only open a little bit. There was a sock covering the smoke detector in the room, there is no phone in the room so if you need to speak to reception you need to come down and the queues are very long. The mattress is not firm, it needs to be changed, the showers are small and have littke curtains so the water goes on the floor. If you are looking for somewhere cheap and don't mind subtropical temperatures then try it. If you are looking for a bit of quality, good service the best not to. The rooms don't come cheap either.... I am taking a small fan with me for tonight, I hope I sleep better tonight....

Reviews.Title: “Absolute hole - avoid...”
Reviews.Author: stuartemms
Reviews.Content: Great location a stone's throw away from the London office but this is a horrible hotel more suited for backpackers than business travellers

Reviews.Title: “"Cheap", no frills, terrible service, hot and stuffy...”
Reviews.Author: maxnhannah
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here one night early in July. It was near the train we needed to catch to Edinburgh the next day and was cheap, so it fit the bill. If you're looking for a cheap, "cookie-cutter" hotel with no frills and terrible service--this is for you. The good: the bed was fair, there was a TV and the shower was nice. The bad: the customer service was the worst we experienced during our seven week vacation, staying at hotels all around the world. They just couldn't be bothered to do anything. One of beds didn't have any bedding (a couch bed we'd paid for) and so we went down and asked about it. They handed us a pile of bedding and we took it back upstairs. The two people who touched the bedding in our family left the next day with all kinds of bug bites all over. When I told the receptionist, she didn't seem to care at all. The best part for me didn't have anything to do with the hotel, but with the location. I discovered a cemetery across the road where John Bunyan, Daniel Defoe, WIlliam Blake, John Owen, Isaac Watts and Susanna Wesley were buried... Subway and bus service was close, too.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: rovinman
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Sunday night having stayed in an Easyhotel the previous night. It sounds funny, but after the tiny room we had at Easyhotel, the Travelodge room seemed like luxury, given the much larger room and TV (without payment). The hotel is a five minute walk from Old Street underground station on the Northern line. It is not as well placed as we would have liked but at the price we paid, we were more than happy to have to travel a little further back and forth. It's a typical Travelodge and appeared quite well managed and maintained. New automatic check-in machines were in use and worked well. Helpful staff were on hand. We had a very good night's sleep with no surrounding noise. There are a couple of interesting aspects to the hotel's location. The John Wesley House Museum is just up the street and the graveyard opposite is of interest as the graves of William Blake, Daniel Defoe and John Bunyan are there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: piglet
Reviews.Content: For £32 (exc breakfast) I wasn't expecting much but was still disappointed! None of the automated check in machines were working and the queue to check in was not going anywhere fast. The family in front of me had already queued once and had to start again and the child was upset to see his mother so distressed. It was baking hot in reception and there is no aircon (anywhere in the hotel!) so I wasn't happy by the time I got to the front of the queue. I was even less happy to be told I had already checked in! After convincing them I hadn't I was given a room on the 5th floor only to find someone else already in it by the time I got there! Back in the queue I confronted the front desk staff who just simply gave me another key to another room. I asked for a fan but was told they only had one and it was out already. Even though I had paid for breakfast I was not given a voucher which casued a bit of problem when I did go for breakfast the next day. The room was standard travelodge and I expected nothing more. The sheets and towels were clean but the carpet could have done with a vacuum. Shame the window only opened a few inches as I cooked alive all night due to the unseasonably high temperatures. I had to shut it anyway as it was so noisy from the revelers below (the room was at the back of the hotel not the busy street). Once shut the room was fairly quiet and we didn't really hear much noice on our floor although several people from floor 7 were kept up all night by people in the hallway. The bed was soft and we kept rolling together but I couldn't sleep anyway as it was so hot. Breakfast was not quite the worst I've ever had but it wasn't worth the money. The food area was messy with uncleaned tables and one member of staff frantically trying to refil things. The orange juice is squash with bits floating in it and the coffee is awful. Most of the staff seemed to walking around in a daze and offered no customer service (in fact the guy that checked me into someone else's room was the manager!) I've stayed in other travelodges before and would stay again (if I had to) but it wouldn't be my first choice. I'd rather pay a bit more and get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Marshwiggle
Reviews.Content: Check in and reception were efficient and friendly, although was not asked if I wanted breakfast so had to be done via a separate transaction. Next morning the breakfast staff had no record of me paying for breakfast but luckily I had the receipt in my pocket to prove I had paid! The lift are and corridors were really hot and stuffy. The room I was allocated on the 4th floor was quite large with a window overlooking the central attrium of the building - a bit grim. This window that opened about 6 inches was the only source of ventilation in the room - which was quite warm! Decor can best be descibed as basic and functional.. The flat screen TV had the basic freeview channels but the picture quality was not that good.TV alarm function didn't seem to work so had to rely on the alarm on my mobile in the morning. Bathroom was small with just a shower. The towels were just hanging on a hook on the back of the bathroom door - I really wondered if they had in fact been changed! But they did smell fresh and clean. The shower in the morning stayed warm for about 2 minutes before going cold! Breakfast was OK with limited choice. Orange juice from the machine was only slightly better than orange squash. Hot buffet choice was limted to bacon, sausage, beans and scrambled egg. At 7:15am the breakfast room was not very busy, bit I saw signs that hinted you should be prepared for a wait later in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge v Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: BasilOswestry
Reviews.Content: I can quite understand why Premier Inn has overtaken Travelodge in the budget chain stakes. We booked a twin room and got a disabled room with no second bed. Went back to reception and waited 20 mins whilst annoyed Germans were trying to convince receptionist they had a valid booking. We were eventually allocated second room to find it mirror image of first. Went back to reception for another 10 min wait to be allocated so called family room. Auotomated booking in system was causing problems for other guests. New room allocated bu no bedding for couch. The hotel was unbearably hot in all rooms but on landings it must hav been in excess of 30 degrees C. Carpets stained and shabby. Ambience dark and forbidding situated next to building site where dog barked all night. Dustbins emptied at 0600 hrs and laundry lorry at 0645 hrs. Except for one new employee, staff unhelpful in extreme. Having been promised bedding on late return, not surprised to find it had not been delivered. Typical of low London standards and not a patch on Premier Inn. They need to go back to the drawing board.

Reviews.Title: “A big echoey room ... with bugs”
Reviews.Author: herrdoktorc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before but aways on a room on City Road. I was pleasantly surprised to have an interior room this time. Light and airy and Travelodge basic, the window could be left open which on a very warm day ensured that the room stayed relatively cool. I woke to find I'd been bitten (bed bugs?) quite badly during the night. This is a first for me in ANY hotel. Breakfast service wasn't quite ready for the rush of holiday travellers at 7am (another first, it's been full of business travellers when I've visited before) and even when I left it was notable that there were still a few items that hadn't been brought out. I'd probably still stay there as I suspect these were one-off incidents. The self-service check-in option was a surprise but the system was very easy to use and found my reservation with no problems from my name and postcode (I would have had to dig around to get my reservation number). A hint to foreign travellers is probably to have your reservation number available when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good base................”
Reviews.Author: NCX
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times since it opened about 2/3 years ago. As you'd expect, being a Travelodge it offers excellent vfm - particularly if you can include a Sunday night in your stay! Accommodation seems to be better from 5th floor up - maybe becasue it doesn't get used as much? There are signs in the corridors of wear and tear - but it will have had a lot of traffic. Rooms are basic (as you'd expect) but very clean. Moorgate / CIty Road area is accessible for all areas and Liverpool Street and Spitalfields are within walking distance. Restaurant/bar attached - and several nearby. If you're not going to spend too much time in the hotel its a perfect base and place to stay in London

Reviews.Title: “Take a hairdryer and toiletries - this is no frills!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashgale
Reviews.Content: Check in, all is fine. No hairdryer in my room though, so I went to reception and I was only allowed to sign one out for 1/2 an hour. Considering this hotel was as expensive as others, you would think this is a basic in any hotel room. We booked a family room as it was me and my mum, but the sofa bed is really not for sleeping on. Then I took a shower and my whote towel was stained all over! I took it to reception and recommended they threw it in the bin but I expect it's back out in circulation. It may have been clean but a hotel that uses white towels must be prepared to throw them away when they get stained! Breakfast is not worth £6.50 either - you can eat in the surrounding areas!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapppointing, even for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabmania
Reviews.Content: I had booked with totalstay.com, and like the man who tried to check-in before me- there was no 'in house' method of finding our bookings- I had to wait 40 minutes (hint- offer me a free cup of tea- it's not difficult). I had booked and paid for bed and breakfast, but had to ask for a breakfast voucher. I wish I hadn't- was that really orange juice? Never ! Beans- cold. Toast?-warm (ish bread). I wasn't brave enoughto try the coffee. The bed was soft and spongy and generally not good. TV and digital radio with a choice of radio1/25 and talksport- how about radio 4 for the adults? Toilet seat held together by white gaffer tape. How crap is that? Buy a new one at a hardware shop! I've stayed here before, it'sa great location, but i won't be back in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL waste of money...spend extra and stay somewhere thats not a dorm room!”
Reviews.Author: Coles53
Reviews.Content: Usually I would recommend a travelodge - which is the exact reason we booked this one - but I would think twice before recommending City Road - worse one we've ever stayed in. The rooms feel like a dormitory on a school trip, they are tiny with no air conditioning (and on one of the hottest days of the year that can get pretty uncomfortable), our view was concrete and pipes in an internal courtyard,... Couldnt believe it when I realised there was no iron, hairdryer etc - went to reception to get one and was told I had half an hour to return it!! Never known anything like it. Terrible place, complete waste of money... worth spending an extra £40 or so to get somewhere comfortable (which is exactly what we'll be doing next time!) Also I know people say 'well to get somewhere in central london for the money what do you expect..' my answer to that is we paid £100 to stay for one freekin night so I can rant all I want... lol...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again will we use Travelodge!!!”
Reviews.Author: MBUK37
Reviews.Content: There are not enough adjectives to describe this shambolic excuse for a hotel.Arrived and one of our rooms had been cancelled( not by us ) we had to pay £150 for a 2 night stay when we had already paid up front £50 already.The room was smelly had to ask for extra towels and pillows twice which never arrived.Breakfast was a mass of dirty plates, uncleared tables, people fighting for cups and plates to eat off.The spare bedding from our room was cleared before we had left so we had to re request.Contacted customers services so they could refund the money we paid due to their error but 6 days later no contact!!!! NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Typical Travelodge - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: bobarooney
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for two nights for a grand total of £70. When you pay that little to stay near enough to the centre of London - I don't think there's really any room for complaint!! I found the check in staff adequate. There was generally a wait in order to speak to someone, but any queries that I had were resolved quickly. We arrived not long after 12 and requested an early check in for £10. We were allocated a room quickly and sent on our way - great start. The room was fresh, bright and clean - and liked the fact that the tv had the freeview channels. As has been mentioned previously, City Road is extremely busy. If you are a light sleeper and/or partial to a moan, I would recommend requesting a room at the back of the hotel or rather dig deeper in your pockets and stay elsewhere. We were on the first floor looking out on City Road (so coudn't really have been any closer to street traffic unless we pitched a tent on the pavement) and I can honestly say that that the noise did not bother us one bit and we slept soundly both nights. Yes you can hear the traffic, and I heard a cheeky little ambulance siren at 11pm one night, but hello, you're in the centre of London. One thing I found odd was that on a Sunday, everything near the hotel is closed - even Marks and Spencer and local restaurants. It was like a ghost town but as it's the City district there is very little going on out of business hours. Overall, I would recommend this travelodge if you get a good deal like we did. You really can't - and shouldn't - complain considering how inexpensive it is. It's a little bit better than no frills accommodation with a comfy bed. Like someone said before, the worst part of the hotel was some of the other guests, and their attitudes...

Reviews.Title: “£32 FOR 1 NIGHT AND 3 BREAKFAST NO FRILLS 8/10”
Reviews.Author: angesouthport
Reviews.Content: Located about 5 minutes from about 4 stations so easy to get to. Staff on arrival was extremley rude check out rota for arrival at 3pm on the 2nd may. For gods sake we arrived at 2:40 and wouldnt even check house keeping to see if room was ready. Fortunatley another member off staff helped us check in with automated service. Room was okay. Have to say that Travelodge beds a re REALLY comfy. BREAKFAST Although the Breakfast queue was absolutley ridiculous and only a handful of staff had to say that the organisation was a mess. But really I got 3 Breakfast for £6.50 as the 2 children were FREE so Travelodge quick recovery for a bad review WELL DONE. Breakfast was really nice and lots to choose from. SUGGESTION FOR BREAKFASTS I know it was a Bank Holiday weekend and most people want to get up early why not open an hour earlier and ask staff what time slot they would like for their breakfast so that QUEUES never happen as it really dappens the stay. I only paid £32.00 for one night for 3 people and 3 Breakfast so all in all was a really good deal. 8/10 ( You lose 2 points because of queues) Would probably stop again if i COULDNT GET ANOTHER tRAVELODGE

Reviews.Title: “good hotel...again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RamonSpain
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend 30 April-3 May. This is our third visit to the hotel, which is perfect with regards to locatios/transportation. There's a bus stop right at the door and Moorgate and Old Street tube station are very near. We were given a room on the 3rd floor and the 3 nights sleep were perfect. I had forgotten some printed tickets at home and the staff at reception were really useful. They gave a personal email address to re-send them my email from one of the 4 computer they have and they very kindly printed the tickets for me. These were tickets for the Darwin Cocoon Centre and the girls were really excited about this visit. So, once again, no thrills, excellent price, we had what we expected and the price was perfect. In fact, we have room booked for August.

Reviews.Title: “Was unexpectedly impressed”
Reviews.Author: dancer2303
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Travelodge for one night with our 8 year old daughter and were very pleased. The room was clean and comfortable and in a noise free location. The breakfast was good, although there was a wait at one point for them to top everything up, but other than that the best travelodge we have stayed in and we would definately stay here again. The location is a little out of town, the nearest tube station is closed at weekends (Old street tube) but for the peaceful nights rest it was worth it. The cost was very good as we paid £48 including breakfast for the three of us.

Reviews.Title: “For just under £100 a night its very poor value”
Reviews.Author: octogonoctopus
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and 9 year old daughter stayed here for 4 nights- never again. I know you get what you pay for but £400 is a lot of money to me and for an uncomfortable double bed and a stain ridden sofa bed I feel it is only just above hostel standard. The room itself was like a prison cell, had bits of chewing gum on the floor, a leaking toilet and excrement on the bathroom door along with the aforementioned stains. It is in a good location, but I would go for an smaller independant hotel if I was to go back to London. Which I won't.

Reviews.Title: “Nosiy Hotel which is understaffed and offers poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Ward_CleaverLeeds
Reviews.Content: Booked in for three nights for work reasons. On arrival (17.30) the queue for check in was huge, massive. The auto check ins were all broken. Following a 40 min wait for someone to process my reservation I was hummed at, treated badly and generally made to feel like I was not important enough to treat with some manners. Trying to get the pre-paid meal my company had paid for was horendous, loads of waiting around, faxing gnashing of teeth and generaly poor communication. When the meal did arrive it was ok. The room itself was nice, clean and large but seemed to be very stripped even for a Travelodge. The only thing worse than the staff and lack of service was the noise, constant traffic, what sounded like trains and other racket. I have stayed in far quieter hotels than this on motorway junctions. Other things wrong, card coded for 1 day and not 3 which lead to me once again queuing for ages, some were lifts "out of service", and a dirty towell. Plus points, the breakfast was ok and the location was good for what I was doing. Overall I would not use this hotel again or recommend it to anyone I liked.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a cheap deal you'll be happy, if you pay full price you'll be pi***d off!!”
Reviews.Author: emalou2
Reviews.Content: Having trawled the net for cheap hotels for a theatre break we chose this one for £25 a night (or thereabouts) We arrived at 1300hrs to find we couldnt check in till 1500hrs so dont expect this on arrival. We paid £10 for the room early as we wanted to get changed for theatre and as i'd had the room cheap i didnt mind too much. We stayed in room 117 which is right at the end of the corridoor so you dont get people walking by making a noise. The problem we thought were: 1. Rooms on front (as most people say on here) ARE noisy, but this is the city of London so if you are happy sleeping through deliveries at 0500hrs you'll be ok!, the road is VERY busy and traffic passes through at all hours so dont expect a quiet lane which has the occasional car. Ask for a room on the rear if you are a light sleeper. 2. There was only 1 X Bath towel and 1 X Hand towel issued? Why for a double room? 3. The room smelt of damp which presumabley came from the bathroom although the bathroom itself didnt smell. 4. My partner said his pillows smelt of cat pee!? However the laundry did appear to be clean. 5. No parking facilites and nearest NCP charges £36 for 24hrs 6. No Hair dryers in room (girls take your own) 7. No phones in room so if you want to have a rant you cant. On a positive note the room had a basic standard of cleanliness, the shower was very nice when the water eventually warmed up. My other half said the room was cold but the heater soon warmed it up and I wasnt cold in there. The foyer is ok with an express check in facility so that was pretty straight forward, there is a cafe/bar for you on site with vending machines in the foyer. The location is good, near to theatres (taxi distance) and there are a few pubs nearby. I would have been very disappointed had i spent full price to stay here, its a large lodge with many rooms, coridoors need a bit of a facelift but decor was basic throughout. If you are able to get this hotel cheap rates I think you'll be satisfied, top price you would expect more from a Travelodge. I cant comment on the staff as i never spoke to them but some people on here have written reviews that say they were rude. Id like to give a pretty fair report by saying it's ok, it is noisy but what would one expect from its location. I would recommend to a friend but would state these issues prior to their travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and suitable for family with children”
Reviews.Author: Rachel66
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Easter Holidays with husband, 10 year old and 4 year old. Check in not until 3pm which was could be a hassle if you arrive early as no left luggage service available. On line check in smooth - room was good size and at the back of the hotel facing a side street which made it lovely and quiet at night. Big double bed, and a large sofa bed which pulled out to make two singles. Rooms cleaned daily. All staff were polite and efficient. Usual buffet breakfast available from 7 til 10am. Lots to choose from and all well cooked. Didn't eat in the evening in the bar but food looked good and was reasonably priced. Five minute walk from "Old Street" on the tube which was ideal. Would stay again without a doubt. Good value for money in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very rude!!!”
Reviews.Author: weemacd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Travelodge's up and down the country including this one and have always found value for money, but on a recent trip to London I had a bad experience. My friends and I had booked this hotel in advance last July for a concert. We had planned in advance to check in early as we were getting the over night bus from Glasgow so we paid the £10 early check in fee when we booked. We had booked a saver family room for the three of us. Check in - After arriving into London at 7am we did a few tourist things til we were able to check, We got to the hotel at 1145 we thought we would chance our luck incase they would let us check in a wee bit earlier but the very RUDE girl on reception said we have to wait til early check in which starts at 1200. We told her we'd wait in the bar which we did and had a few drinks which were seriously over priced. At 12 we went back to reception and the rude girl told us there were no family rooms ready and it would be another 20mins before they would have one for us. So went back to the bar for another over priced round. There was a family at the table next to us and they were boasting to another family who had just came in that they had arrived at 1045 and were told if they had paid £10 there and then they could check in and get a room, so the 2nd family went to reception and within minutes returned with the key to a family room. As we had been told we werent allowed to check in before 12 and then told that there were no rooms ready for us at 1200 we weren't exactly happy. At reception there was now a rude man aswell as the rude woman who said she thought we had left. 1310 we got our room. Our second night stay was booked under my friends name so we asked if we could just keep the same room and the man said that it was fine but when we came down for breakfast the next morning the new man on reception was a bit hostile towards us. he had no change and asked us to get the correct change before we could eat, we asked could we not bring it down after breakfast and he said no we're not allowed because we are checking out. We then told him we weren't and that we had the 2nd booking that the rude man from the day before had okayed us for keeping the same room, we also told him of the problems from the day before. After we went back to our room to find change to pay for breakfast the man on reception told us that we have to give our credit card details, I told him that my details were already on their system. This was another trip back to the room before breakfast. We told him that were weren't happy about the way the staff had treated us, we were not offered any refund on our early check in fee nor an apology. when we finally got to breakfast - not a lot of selection but it is a travelodge so didnt expect much but no clean cups or cutlery and lots of dirty dishes left by the food which i found a little un hygenic. The room itself was ok very basic, but walls are paper thin can hear everything thats going on outside. Location was a 2 minute walk from Moorgate tube station so handy for getting around central London. My friends and I have stayed here before and never had any problems but after this experience we will not be going back or reccomending it to anyone. The only member of staff that was friendly and approchable was the maid that was in the corridor when we got to our room and needed an extra towel.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return”
Reviews.Author: xiv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Travelodge City Road four (4) weekends last autumn, in September, October, November and December. I had made all the reservations at the same time, because it was cheap and very close to a College I attend in the weekends. I just hated the hotel from the first to the last stay. The only thing positive I can say is that the rooms are large, and the beds pretty good. But that's all. The smell is just awful and scary, the noice i terrible. I woke up every night I slept there, of drunk people partying in the hallways/corridor, knocking at all the doors singing, puking, fighting and making so much noise. There were no phone at the room, and it was impossible to find any way to call the reception, and I never dared leaving my room in the night to ask the people working there to take action. The reception area is very dull and the staff doesn't seem like that they have a very comfortable job. The breakfast area is like a smelly industry hall, and the breakfast is horrible, but cheap. The last night of my last stay I found another person's worn nightgown in my bed :-( . There are one small pillow, no soap or shampoo, hairdryer or any such things at the rooms, but that is also said in the hotels descriptions so it should not be a surprise i you have read all the conditions before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, cold and overpriced, stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: cruella55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night recently and certainly wish we hadn't! The only reason I stayed here is because I was having an eye operation at nearby Moorfields and wanted to get a room before normal checking-in time so I could go straight there afterwards. We paid extra to have early check-in but when we got to the hotel we were told that our room was not ready! We then had to sit in the dirty attached restaurant waiting for our room. At this point I desperately needed to put eye drops in and the receptionist suggested I do this in the toilet!! Very hygenic!! When we eventually got to our room we were appalled. Although the room was large, the only items in it were a bed and a table with the tv etc on. The rest of the space was just empty, like an oversized prison cell. And it was freezing! The window was wide open (this was during the snowy weather) and the tiny heater took hours to warm up so I spent the entire afternoon under the duvet trying to stay warm. There was no bath, just a stained grotty shower, no remote control for the tv and only one pillow each. Also there was only a total of one hand towel and one bath towel for the room. I wouldn't mind if I had got this room for the advertised rate of £19, that I do not believe actually exists, but I paid £105 for this! Never again. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money....”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a family room with 2 friends. We found our family room spacious and very clean. Location was good as it's near the tube station, we bought travel cards and changed at Euston or Kings Cross to pick up the tubes to the main sights. You could do a lot worse in London! Only down side was nothing was open on Sunday morning as it's a business district and we struggled to find somewhere for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern and value for money”
Reviews.Author: pseudonomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights Very clean, modern facilities Friendly staff Good location Cafes/supermarkets near by

Reviews.Title: “What a contrast to the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Debandez
Reviews.Content: My daugher and I have just returned from a Friday night at the City Rd Travelodge (Family room for £25 ) prepared for the 'Travelodge from Hell' by reading some of the previous reviews on Tripadvisor. We were more than happy with our stay. The reception staff were friendly and allowed us to pay £10 to check into our room at 12pm as oppose to the usual time - 3pm. Our room was at the front of the hotel, it was a large family room, number 315 (I normally book family rooms for the additional space - same price as normal room), it was immaculately clean, spacious, king size bed (2 pillows only but as we had booked family room we got one more for the additional sofabed), if you like soft to medium beds you will LOVE the beds here (myself and my daughter loved it for comfort and size), views of the armoury opposite (like a beautiful old castle). We could hear road noise quite significantly but it was no problem for us (if road noise is a problem for you sleeping then I would request a room at the back of the hotel) we slept like logs to be honest. We took our own hairdryer after reading in the reviews that non was provided in the room. We also took our own bath/shower gels etc although they do provide a small bar of soap. The bathroom was spotless and the shower powerful.The flatscreen TV worked fine and the coffee making facilities were adequate although we missed the usual shortbread biscuits! This Travelodge is ideally located for making the most of a stay in London ( Moorgate Tube Station being 5 mins walk away - 4 stops from Euston ) and the staff were happy to help us to find our way about the city. We could not leave our luggage after check out as they do not provide that facility so we had to take it to Euston and pay £8 per item! Not the hotels fault. We would have no hesitation in making a repeat booking.

Reviews.Title: “totally basic budget hotel - don't go if a good nights sleep is important!”
Reviews.Author: Depon
Reviews.Content: It's a very basic hotel, good if you don't like surprises. The location is comfortable, close to a tube station, and there are lots of places to eat around. Breakfast at the hotel is a big no - the quality was very low and there was a small choice of goods. There was not a single cheese and not anything with chocolate in it! I mean if I am having breakfast at a hotel there should be something to indulge! The room is very basic, but clean and spacious. The shower head is fixed on the shower and it makes it hard to take a shower without making your hair wet. Quite disturbing! The biggest minus of the room was that there was soooo much noise from the clubs in the neighborhood on friday and saturday night - there were 2 clubs under our window. There was also plenty of noise from inside the hotel - children running and screaming in the corridor very early in the morning plus doors slamming. Finally the bed mattress was of very poor quality. Apart from these though the hotel is not a bad value for money - if a centrally located, economical place to stay is what you are looking for then it is a solution.

Reviews.Title: “Like a punishment”
Reviews.Author: Jeasey
Reviews.Content: I have had the misfortune to have to stay with this hotel a number of times through work- however there was always something wrong with it and in the end things became so bad that it has been removed as our preferred hotel despite it being the cheapest. I’ll start with the ****WORST THING BY FAR *** so you don’t miss it—this hotel overbooks it’s rooms on purpose in expectation that some people won’t turn up, so if you check in late you may very well find there’s no room for you. This was the reason it was finally and deservedly blacklisted by my company- some colleagues and I were staying at the hotel one night, all our rooms had been block booked and paid for in advance and our director went to check in at almost 11pm to be told that there were now no rooms left and he would have to go to WEMBLEY which was the nearest place they had a room, they wouldn’t give him any help to get there and no other assistance, they wouldn’t refund his room as they said there was a perfectly good one in Wembley waiting for him, they wouldn’t give him internet use to find an alternative. This must happen every night as their attitude was completely indifferent and almost as if they thought he deserved it for arriving late. In the end a colleague and I ended up sharing a double bed together and giving our director the spare room, but when I went downstairs to get extra towels at almost midnight there were FIVE people in reception who this had happened to also- including a young woman of about 20 and travelling alone and one woman who was staying for 5 days and had pre-paid the room- they had still given it away! For anyone that doesn’t know London that well Wembeley is way, way, way out of town and by this time of night the tubes are shutting down- a taxi would have been horrifically expensive too. The other bad points about the room in general include no hairdryer and they probably keep about 2 behind the desk as they are NEVER available; no toiletries; no phone in the room so if you have a problem there’s no way of reporting it without making a trip all the way down to reception; the corridors are also stiflingly, sick-makingly hot, so when you do have to traipse round endless corridor after corridor you end up really sweating and feeling ill. The first time I stayed there I thought the window was frosted but on closer inspection it turned out that the view was a white wall about 6 feet away from the glass- nice! Another time I stayed in room 24 or something like that and was kept awake until after midnight and then woken up again at 6am by an unbelievably loud rumbling noise coming from underneath my room. As there was no phone I had to get dressed to go down to reception- when I did report it the manager said ‘oh yes that was probably Tesco next door’ so apparently some of the rooms on the 1st floor are over the tesco delivery bay! Another time I was given a duff key three times and this room was on the sixth floor- it took me half an hour and three trips up and down in those boiling corridors with my bags just to get into my room- every time the staff couldn’t have cared less and made that quite clear. Breakfast is pretty terrible with a huge hunk of sweaty bacon all stuck together and covered in white gunk, there is one toaster and one hot water and milk dispenser and always a queue waiting to use them, the bread and sausages are always disgusting- I only ever have fruit and yogurt as the hot stuff is so horrible and I am not a fussy eater! Don’t stay here unless you find a very good deal, we were paying about £90 a night B&B on a weeknight which is good for London but a rip off for this hotel- if you want somewhere cheap nearby I suggest the Holday Inn on Old street which, although not the ritz has never let me down.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at this hotel cost me a lot of money in parking”
Reviews.Author: d3bz26
Reviews.Content: We arrived during the night only to find that there were no parking facilities. We were directed to Finsbury NCP by Travelodge staff. I drove to the bottom of the ramp only to discover that the charges were £36 for 24hrs I had difficulty reversing back out as the ramp was steep. We drove around for ages trying to find another place to park. The next day we found another car park they charged us £20 for 24hrs. They said that Travelodge claim that there are parking facilities and usually direct their customers to them. I thought that this was quite deceptive as Travelodge hotels usually have parking facilities with reasonable rates. I won't be staying there again!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Travelodge City Road. The hotel itself is located along City Road which is pretty busy street. It is pretty close to Old Street Station (take exit 4 and then it is less than 5 minutes walk) but it is also walkable from Liverpool Street Station (which may be more convenient depending on how one arrives. I like the location but if you wish to be very close to all the sights it is not perfect. We were however to a large extent after the nightlife of nearby Hoxton and Shoreditch and for that is a good location. We had a family room which is supposed to sleep 3 but there was actually room to sleep 4. The bed was comfortable however the foldout sofa was a bit too hard. The room had a TV with a few channels (a bit irritating that the channels were in a random order which meant a lot of zapping on the remote) and there was also a water kettle. From what I understood it was possible to borrow hair dryer and other stuff from the front desk. The room was clean and I was actually surprised that the changed towels and linen every day. One thing that I was expecting in the room was shower gel and shampoo but there was only soap but the bathroom had a bath tub. The front desk staff were not rude however they were not exactly friendly and helpful either. They were a bit difficult a bit given each of us our own key card to the room and they were not very knowledgeable about the area or London in general. The value is however great. We paid £19 per room and night and at it is pretty unbeatable at that price. Do not expect something special - it is a basic budget hotel but is clean and reasonably comfortable. Do try to get a room facing the back (away from City Road) as I heard a few other guests complaining about noise - we did however not hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good for business, not for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Irons01
Reviews.Content: Basic travelodge hotel, clean and tidy, but no soul!! When you check in ask for a room on floor 5 or above, it's quieter (just). Breakfast is an all you can eat affair, so don't expect top quality, or choice,,,,, but it's not too bad! The location of the hotel is not good for sight seeing, but is fine if your on local business. The main let down (for me) was the 'no left luggage' policy, forcing me to lug my case to a conference.

Reviews.Title: “had to ask for bedding three times”
Reviews.Author: happyholidayer8
Reviews.Content: apart from having to go to reception 3 times to get extra bedding it was fine, very close to old street tube station and we asked for a room at the back so it wasn't too noisy, plenty of hot water, breakfast good, paid £51 for 3 of us inc. breakfast so think that's pretty good for london, would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap convenient for The City”
Reviews.Author: thelittle1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights whilst attending a training course in Artillery Lane. Very convenient for me, only 10 min walk to from the hotel. Was on 7th Floor in a room at the back of the hotel - great views across the city. All OK, large, quiet and clean room - have to agreed about the lukewarm shower water but hey... The bar/cafe was fine -food a little hit and miss in the evenings - breakfast perfect. There are plenty of places around the hotel to grab a bite to eat/coffee so it wasn't a issue. Close to Liverpool St and Old St tubes. All in all enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but can be nosiy”
Reviews.Author: SFB123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this travelodge many times, cause its very conveneient for me with work, if I can't be bothered to commute. Due to the bad weather, I stayed up in london and had paid £39 (in advance) for the room so can't complain at the price. It is one of the newest travelodges in London and it is nice and clean. If you stay on the 1st floor and your room is to the front, it can be very noisy as there are about 3 bus stops right outside the window, and you can hear everything. Some of the windows don't shut properly so it's hard to get ot sleep, and then you are woken up in the morning (early). There is a also a gentelemans bar next door so sometimes you can hear the music. You are better off with a room at the back of the hotel and 3rd floor or above. It is a good location for the "CITY". Liverpool street 10 mins walk, moorgate of City Road (3-4 minutes walk). This Travelodge isn't luxury but nice, clean & simple rooms.

Reviews.Title: “COLD”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamThomas
Reviews.Content: The reception area was clean and tidy and the ppl were very friendly and even moved me to a higher floor when asked at check in, but.. The room was cold and the radiator did not serve its purpose even on max the room was never 'temperature comfortable'. The room also had the following faults; The security lock on the window was broken allowing the window to be fully opened not good if you have a minor. There was no glass in the peephole in the door therefore allowing anybody to place anything through the door via the hole. The water pressure in the shower was low and the water even on high was luke warm. The shower had 2 parts misplaced, easily water went on the floor. The faults were noted and given to the reception upon departure so hopefully they can fix things before the next customer checks in.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap clean but alittle out of the way”
Reviews.Author: vodka444
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights with my daughter and a friend not a good start as couldnt find the hotel everyone we asked sent us in a different direction. Was surprised at room on arriving -so bare but was clean and met our need, with tea and coffee making facilities and both shower and bath. Only 1 bath and hand towel but was given more at reception. Room was warm but not too hot . It was nice to have the cafe breakfast was £7.50 and included a cooked breakfast. The service was alittle poor often no bacon or mugs available and no eggs as they were awaiting a delivery! On our last day checkout was at 12 midday which was great but we were not going until 3 there was no where to store our cases so it cost us £10 to book the room on for 2 hours ! We only paid £19 for the night!!! I would not stay here again as it was out of the way but it was fine for 2 nights. We did not have any problems with noise either inside or outside.

Reviews.Title: “A very frustrating hotel”
Reviews.Author: newy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights from 1st Jan. Its extremely basic and we had three main grievances. Firstly theres no hairdryer in the room. The leaflet provided states to go to reception and ask for one. We did this on 4 occasions and they did not have any. We were told they would send one up when available and this did not happen. Bottom line, take your own or you may not get one. Secondly, we asked at reception three times for an extra pillow (as only 3 are provided in a double room), on all occasions we were told they did not have any so one of us had to sleep on one rather flat and uncomfortable pillow. Thirdly, they wont leave another toilet roll if there is more than a quater of a roll left which is absolutely ridiculous...we had to return to reception on 2 occasions to ask for another one which is something that should never happen when a room is cleaned daily (which these are) - it is incredibly frustrating having to make lots of stops at reception on your way in and out of the hotel. Attitude of the staff is very much 'couldn't care less' when it comes to things not already provided in the room, they come across as arrogant and lazy. The room itself was basic but clean and the location is good. Breakfast is okay. That's all I can say that is remotely positive about this hotel. Basically, in denying things such as extra pillows and a hair-dryer (something they say they provide) and forcing customers to make the journey to reception for basics such as soap and toilet roll they really know how to frustrate their customers and in doing this, all they are saving is a few pence.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: PRprofessional
Reviews.Content: Travelodge is basic but clean. not the most comfortable in the world, but the beds are big and the rooms are quiet. Great location and some of the best prices in London. This is definitely a no frills hotel though. No toiletries, and if you need a hairdryer you have to ask at reception and they lend it to you for half an hour only! So if it's comfort and accessories you're after i'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It's Not Just A Crack House It's A Crack Home”
Reviews.Author: stinkfish
Reviews.Content: The location is good but that is about it. My room was like a jail cell. No telephone in the room so I could not get messages. You have to request soap. They have a machine where you can buy shampoo. I went to the front desk three times to complain that my toilet did not work and that my bathroom floor was flooding. They never fixed it. The absolute worst. Do yourself a favor, get a better hotel or sleep in a homeless shelter. You will be better off either way.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast service was the worst I have experienced anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: Jason_CManchester
Reviews.Content: You don't expect luxury in a Travelodge but this hotel left a very bad taste in the mouth and I won't be going back. Location ok for central London and the room was clean enough. The breakfast service for each of the two mornings I stayed was truly appaling. Tables left uncleared, broken drinks machines, no cutlery or crockery for long periods, there was a constant stream of complaints and almost a full blown riot. What the foreign visitors must have made of it, heaven knows. Complete inefficiemcy and disorganised chaos. We demanded, and received, a full refund afterwards but it was an experience I would not like to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: hotel_mazza
Reviews.Content: ADVANTAGES: Very cheap for a london hotel (we paid £79 a night room only for a family room). Comfortable, warm rooms with tv, tea tray and one of the best power showers I've ever had in a hotel/B&B. Excellent location, only a few minutes walk from Old Street, Moorgate and Liverpool Street Stations. There are plenty of restaurants and stores on the doorstep, although being the commercial district, some of the shops don't open on a weekend which wasn't really a problem for us. There was a restaurant and bar on the ground floor, and although didn't have breakfast at the hotel, it was only £7.50 for all-you-can-eat buffet breakfast. DISADVANTAGES: Very small basic rooms, but there were three of us and we knew in advance that we were getting what we paid for. Our room was above a bar or club which was slighly annoying but I daresay if you requested a quiet room they would do their best to assist you. This travelodge was excellent value for money, fantastic location. We weren't expecting the Ritz and it was a nice comfortable room to come back to after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “do not stop at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: massiveStourbridge
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stopped at this hotel as a package with going to a theatre included. We arrived at the hotel 14:45 and were told we could not book in until 1500 or we would be charged £10 for the priveledge, not a good start. I needed the toilet so selected the one in the bar area and could not go to this unless I had a room key which I obviously did not have. On arriving into our room it was immediately clear that the room had been built recently and at the one end there was a large space where it would appear they had forgotten to put a sofa or some kind of furniture, it was just a large space with nothing in it. The other thing we noticed was the smell which up to now I still couldn't say what it was. We had three pillows in our room so went to the reception to ask for another one (as it was like sleeping on a flat board) to be told 'well you have three don't you?' and that they had not got another one for us. On the second day the cleaner (I will say it was a clean place) left the two of us one hand towel and one bath towel. The hotel was not well situated for the west end theatres and the area it was in was rough, loud and intimidating. It was near to the local tube station so it was good for that. All in all Don't bother!!

Reviews.Title: “if u wanna get robbed, this is your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: idablomst
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went out for dinner, and when we got back the door to our room was wide open and the light was turned on. Our cellphone and i-pod were stolen. When we contacted the reception, they said that they had to contact their boss the next morning before they could do anything, and they said "if u are looking for security, u should check in at the Merriot" When we spoke to the boss the next morning, he had not heard about the robbery, and he didn't seem to care either, even though i made a point out of "good customer service" and bad reputation. We had to find the number to the police by ourself, and the staff was surprisingly little helpful about the whole case. The police said that they already had a lot of complains about that hotel, about the same things, and that the management didn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about inconsiderate guests!!”
Reviews.Author: BROWNIE1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights (23-25th Oct). We just wanted a clean cheap basic hotel to get showered and sleep in. The hotel was quite secure as you had to use your card to enter hotel after 10pm and had to use your card to enter the lifts to the rooms. Rooms were very basic but clean no iron, hairdryer, toiletries, there was tea and coffee but not very much but you only have to ask for more at the reception same if you need more pillows and they do have a hairdryer and iron if you want to borrow one. We stayed in room 641 when we arrived we were supprised as other reviews had complained about noise and the heat the room was quiet no road traffic noise and the room was a nice temp there is a heater on the wall which was controllable.We must of been in the middle of the hotel because the view was other rooms and a wall. So far so good. That was untill Friday night. We got back to the hotel after an evening out at about 11.30 we were disturbed by slamming doors and youngsters going out to the clubs eventually all went quiet at about 12.45am fell asleep then was woken at 4.15am by inconsiderate Americans why do they have to shout they were carrying on the party in the corridoor outside our room I got up and asked them politly to keep there voices down dorrs slammed went quite then again at 4.40am 4.50am 5.20am whan again I told them unpolitly to shut up. They were going from room to room two bokes and two women you only need to use your imagination to know what they were up to. Finally it went quite at 6.20am you could even hear them in their rooms!! Saturday night was slightly better Americans must have left. We did hear a group of English lads going out at about 12.30 and we heard them come in at 6.00am and a girl who had lost her card thet was trying to wake her mate up but we did manage a bit more sleep. To be honest it reminded me of holidays in Teneriffe. We did not use the restaurant. My husband went out sat morning to get a paper and came back with a bacon roll and cappicino from a little cafe near subways, it was the best bacon roll that i had tasted definatly recomended. Mooregate tube station a few mins walk to the right of the hotel(as you leave) we bought Oyster cards much cheeper. We drove to London and used the NCP car park No 20 Paul street there were loads of spaces its not protrolled but my husband checked the car sat morning and is was fine it is £9.20 for 24hours it was a bit difficult paying but that was our fault as we didn't have change and our card would not work in the machine but we registered over the phone and payed that way. It's about 5 min walk from hotel but its at the back of the hotel through side streets. All in all we would have been delighted with the hotel if it hadn't of been spoilt by loud Americans guests, if you are thinking of staying here and expect to go out clubbing please spare a thought for us older guests and keep the noise down in the coridoors.

Reviews.Title: “london was a surprise”
Reviews.Author: thelards
Reviews.Content: We travelled to london with 3 children, 17,8 & 6. Wanted a hotel near to things so that travelling there was reduced and this hotel did provide that. The bus stop outside took you into all the tourist attractions also there was 2 tube stations at each end of the road both 10 minutes walk. oyster cards where the easiest way for us to travel on and it was easy to use. The hotel was basic, the family room was one of the smallest we have ever stopped in but for 3 nights we managed, it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast did provide a good start to long days, the dinners where not so great and there's better around and about. The staff all struggled with there english but did try to be helpful. The security of the card swipe internals doors where reasurring. Overall a pleasent stay but a fantasic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: LancashireExplorers
Reviews.Content: We wanted an economy hotel for three nights and in City Road location. The bus stop immediately outside Travelodge had many routes and regular buses (I picked up a bus map at Euston station and bus 205). I asked for a quiet room with shower and got 7th floor. We had the window closed due to the noise. Room was very clean indeed but basic - no hairdryer, telephone, pictures. Small hanging area and tea/coffee facilities in the room. I purchased the breakfasts in advance which is a little cheaper. Very basic breakfast but had cereals, oranges and grapefruit, yoghurt, cooked food, toast and croissant. 3 lifts all functioned swiftly - the hotel was very busy. Large dining area but it filled by 8 am. on Saturday. North of the hotel is Old Street (Exit 4 for East side of City Road South). I picked up a useful local map in the underground station for the Old Street area. Moorgate underground on the south side too.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: suitcasecarrier
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, close to ameneties and tube stations but oh so noisy! Corridors are boiling hot (room wasnt too bad) but even with windows shut the traffic noise was a pain and a half

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Not So Good.”
Reviews.Author: moreanbeag
Reviews.Content: Like several of the other reviewers we found the rooms to be far too warm/hot with the window closed, and when we opened the window the terrific noise from passing traffic was unbearable and made it difficult, if not impossible to sleep. When the window was closed the traffic noise was still loud, partly owing to the fact that daylight could be seen around the poorly fitted window frame, not only allowing in noise but also a draught., and we remained too hot. The double glazing is totally inadequate, which is surprising to say the least , in a newly refurbished hotel in this noisy location.There was a roller blind at the window ,and as the front of the hotel, where our room was located, is overlooked, it was necessary to have the blind lowered for most of the time we spent in the room. This of course meant that we were always reliant upon the electric lighting whether or not it was daylight outside. Breakfast was disappointing. The very watered down fresh orange juice was disgusting and the cooked items available were never hot, only just warm. Most of the staff were efficient and friendly but service in the restaurant could be extremely slow.A great pity as the location for access to the city is very good. Parking at the nearest NCP is expensive as you might expect. The photograph on the Travelodge website, appearing to depict the hotel is misleading. The picture in fact shows No.1 City Road on the corner, the Travelodge begins at No. 7. further up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Vagab0nd53
Reviews.Content: This is quite a large Travelodge, on the edge of the City. Location is convenient, between two tube stations (Old Street and Moorgate), and with plenty of bars and restaurants close by. My room was on the inside, so no great view but it was quiet enough. It was quite basic but very clean, and everything in good condition. I had a disabled room, so the bathroom was HUGE. The corridors were very hot, but how much time do you spend in the corridor? My room was fine, and the windows opened. The bar/restaurant was very large for a Travelodge - there were plenty of people in there when I arrived, watching the England match. Breakfast was standard but good value for money if booked in advance. I didn't have much interaction with the staff as I only stayed for one night, but reception was efficient and friendly enough, and the restaurant staff also welcoming and polite. Travelodge is a basic, good value chain, especially if you get one of their deals - it's not the hotel experience of a lifetime, but it's a reasonable place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: ambyth86
Reviews.Content: booked a twin room but on arrival got a double room. went back to reception and they said they didnt do twin beds but said we could have a disabled room which was two single beds pushed together. The hotel is easily missed unless your looking for it from the outside. it is a 5min walk to the tube station. There are a few restaurants around the hotel, i recommend the curry place accross the road they do a great chicken korma. the hotel has a bar and somewhere to eat as well as vending machines for drinks and snacks. there are also a few computers to access the internet at a cost but they were constantly busy the whole 3 days i spent there. The rooms are very basic, cream walls, desk, shelves, a very odd chair but it was very clean i must say. not a very good view out of the window unless u like looking at other people in their rooms and others looking at you. Would stay there again, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Our Worst Hotel Experience EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: PamplesPals
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights from Aug 28th to Aug 30th as we were attending a film festival in Leicester Square. We had previously stayed here last year with no real problems so didn't hesitate to book again when we managed to get a room for £29 a night. Check in was quick and easy and the maid service was excellent but they were the only positives of our stay. We were staying on the 5th floor and as soon as you stepped out of the lift the heat hit you, it was like a sauna and the room was barely any cooler. The room itself was perfectly acceptable however the noise from the nightclub somewhere below was atrocious, We were kept awake until 3.30am on all 3 nights by the banging music and car horns and that was with the window closed! Besides this we had trouble entering the hotel late at night on all 3 nights due to the key card not working, having to wait up to 5 minutes for reception to open the door. It wasn't just us this happened to as there was often people stuck outside. All three lifts were broken on the Sunday night Monday morning with everyone having to use the stairs or the tiny emergency lift. As we got the room for £29 a night we could overlook some of these things however for those that pay the full room price it's far from acceptable. The bottom line is that if you do stay here be sure to bring some earplugs or be suitably drunk upon going to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Accommodation - Very Noisy at Night”
Reviews.Author: hbeachy66
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights from Monday 17 August, we booked months ago and got a very cheap deal and the hotel was well worth the price and more. Very clean, staff more than helpful (I got extra towels and pillows every night - no problem). However, the weather has been very very hot and the rooms were boiling, leaving the window open helped but the noise outside from the Tesco Extra next door at closing and opening seemed deafening on our 1st floor room which was at the back of the building, and on Thursday night a disco just down the road made it even worse. All in all I can't complain we got a great deal and for the price it was brilliant, however families with young children may not be able to cope with the noise so easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & price, if you dont mind roasting!!”
Reviews.Author: belindacoles
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend stayed here for 1 night on 10th August, we had booked in advance and it cost us £32 - we had originally booked this for after a Michael Jackson concert, as it was non refundable we decided to go anyway. We have stayed in many travelodges and this hotel was the usual Travelodge standard, though I must say the staff were some of the most polite & helpful we have come across. The hotel has a very large bar and restaurant area which is also a Costa Coffee. We had a night cap and the prices of the alcohol were more than reasonable, in the bar area there are also 3 computers wired up like an internet cafe - £1 for 20mins browsing, which is a good idea in my opinion. Also 3 or 4 vending machines in the reception area. I would 100% agree with others, the corridors & lifts are absolutely ROASTING, its like being in a sauna and isnt very pleasant. The room itself was quite warm but the window did open. We were at the front of the hotel and the road is very nosey but with the window shut at night its fine. Great location, short walk from Moorgate station, again - would agree with others and suggest you avoid Old Street station as its not very nice. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and a few shops and a Tesco exress right next door to the hotel. If you stay midweek you will find the area quite busy as its in one of the banking districts. Overall we had a pleasant stay and the location is convenient and cheap for central London, we headed down to the river by the TATE and had a lovely meal at "The Real Greek" - highly recommend. There is a NCP car park next to the hotel but its pricey and we say homeless people sleeping in the entrance (which is norm for London), so train is much easier and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great location but beware of the heat!”
Reviews.Author: vesty
Reviews.Content: fab location and 4 mins walk to moorgate tube station, don't get me wrong the hotel is clean and the staff are helpful but and this is a very big but....this hotel is roasting hot! The lifts and the corridoors of this hotel are boiling hot with no air con, the rooms are also very warm and because we were on the 7th floor or window only opened a few inches making it an uncomfortable nights sleep. On the plus its handy having a bar on site and we did eat here and the food is average but it's cheap and cheerful and was a good value hotel, it's just a shame they don't put air con in the lifts and corridoors as this would make it less average and more ideal. Oh and we ordered two pints on magners and were given two bottles of magners and tumblers with ice in and were told they only had 7 pint glasses! A pub in london with no pint glasses............shocking! It's funny but Fawlty Towers springs to mind! But hey ho we used it as a base to go and see U2 at wembley and they were amazing! So it was all ok in the end :-)

Reviews.Title: “Try yourself before relying on negative views.....”
Reviews.Author: poppynazza
Reviews.Content: We were checked in very quickly by very friendly staff. The rooms were clean and comfortable. True the windows are only open slightly,but it is a long drop. There was traffic noise, but that was stated in the Travelodge details. Breakfast were fab, what more could anyone ask for..I've read a few negative reviews on here but what do people expect for the price.. GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY.....Will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “poor is not good enough”
Reviews.Author: pandagal
Reviews.Content: no soap in the rooms towels for one in each room (despite threee booked in each) no bedding in each room took 30 mins to check in boiling hot all night despite outside temp bearable kept awake until five am by tooting horns and noise from club we paid very little but for a nightmare chose travelodge by the way because of it functionality and general good value

Reviews.Title: “clean and great value for central london”
Reviews.Author: happy-holls-cj
Reviews.Content: Ok this is a travelodge so you expect basic accomodation but once you have established that this hotel is a great find. Hotel - large, clean, modern, no problems with staff, breakfast, food, bar service and vending machines on all floors. 3 lifts but no left luggage due to security in city location. payable early check in/late check out available. family rooms usually 1st/2nd floor with double bed plus 1 single with extra lower pull out for 4th bed. shower & bath but no toiletries or hairdryer. tv and tea/coffee making facilities in room. Fans available as no air con. Location - set in the heart of the financial city with a bus stop right at the front door and 2 tube stops at each end of the street - moorgate and old street. 5 mins walk to both. Personally prefer moorgate - area not as quiet at night. 10/15min walk from Liverpool St station. Road in front of hotel noisy with traffic and nearby clubs at night but pretty good sound proofing and you are in the centre of london! Mainly office environment but some bars, restaurants, shops and a subway takeaway on same street. Ideally tesco express next door and M&S 2 min away. However very quiet area at weekends most shops/bars late opening or closed. Value - room rates vary from fantastic sale rate of £9.99 to approx £150 per night. Not worth £150 but can get amazing bargains. We paid approx £120 4 nights family of 4!! This is our 2nd stay here after being recommended by a friend and will definately stay again. If like us you plan to spend all day exploring this fab city and will basically just use your hotel to sleep, this is a fab clean, great value choice with excellant transport links. Tip: I would always chose to stay slightly further away from some of the busier areas say the west end where a lot of the hotels are but which is alway noisy and frantic. As long as you are near a bus stop and tube station everything is within 5-10 min tube ride.

Reviews.Title: “Not built for summer”
Reviews.Author: EasyOzzie
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we stayed there over the hottest week in 6 years but didn't ease the lack of air conditioning or a window that could be opened more than 4 inches. The only air conditioned part of the hotel was the reception. As for room service, two of us had one hotel style sliver of soap between us for 4 days. First night in I was awaken at 0215 by the police arresting drunks from the night club over the road from my hotel window; and that was a Sunday night!

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear........”
Reviews.Author: Clo9
Reviews.Content: Ive never written a particularly bad review for a hotel before, I try to highlight any good points it may have but alas, when it comes to the Travelodge, City Road, London, im going to have to be honest. It was appalling. I am actually a fan of Travelodge Hotels in general & have stayed in many of them. To start with, it took us 30 mins to check in, im not sure why as there was only 2 people in front of us. The room was sweltering. The heat could only be relieved by opening a window onto, yes you guessed it, City Road, one of the busiest road in london. Along side that, the hotel is situated beside a strip club in which all sorts of questionable & boisterous characters make there way in & out of all hours of the night. It was funny listening to their conversations the 1st night, the 2nd night, the novelty had worn off along with patience after the police had to be called to sort out a row at 3am. They wouldn't/couldn't change our room although we pleaded with them. The blind fell off the wall the 2nd night so along side heat & noise, we had to endure light. They have vending machines in the foyer for drinks/snacks/toiletries which on both nights would not provide any guest with change to use them which almost caused a riot as people were thirsty. & as for the infamous coffee shop, dont believe them, a member of staff told me the coffee machine never worked! As i said, this is a first for me, normally i will find 1 redeeming thing about a hotel, not not this time.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Value”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Cobbley
